qas.question: What did Kanye call the label he founded in 2004?
As of 2015, who did Kanye choose as the new president of GOOD Music?
What year did Kanye West open his GOOD Music production company and record label?
What other artist besides Kanye West and Common was among the first to record at GOOD Music?
Who did Kanye name President of GOOD Music in 2015?

context: West founded the record label and production company <a0_0>GOOD Music<a0_0/> in <a2_0>2004<a2_0/>, in conjunction with Sony BMG, shortly after releasing his debut album, The College Dropout. <a3_0>John Legend<a3_0/>, Common, and West were the label's inaugural artists. The label houses artists including West, Big Sean, <a1_0><a4_0>Pusha T<a4_0/><a1_0/>, Teyana Taylor, Yasiin Bey / Mos Def, D'banj and John Legend, and producers including Hudson Mohawke, Q-Tip, Travis Scott, No I.D., Jeff Bhasker, and S1. GOOD Music has released ten albums certified gold or higher by the Recording Industry Association of America (RIAA). In November 2015, West appointed Pusha T the new president of GOOD Music.
